content.body: Is it possible to freeze the [[Prototype]] of an ordinary object without wrapping it with Proxy?
Nope. Can only make it non-extensible. Props and prototype all part of the same bag
https://github.com/tc39/proposal-freeze-prototype
https://matrixlogs.bakkot.com/TC39_Delegates/2021-09-20#L1
Is there an es5 way of creating a function with length n (where n is known statically when I'm writing the code), and for which `IsConstructor` returns `false`?
content.formatted_body: Is there an es5 way of creating a function with length n (where n is known statically when I'm writing the code), and for which IsConstructor returns false?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body: Is there an es5 way of creating a function with length n (where n is known statically when I'm writing the code), and for which `IsConstructor` returns `false`?
Is there an es5 way of creating a function with length n (where n is known statically when I'm writing the code), and for which IsConstructor returns false?

content.body: As far as I can tell, in es5, the only functions that don't have a [[Construct]] internal method are all built-ins. So even without the length constraint, the answer looks like no.
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: As far as I can tell, in es5, the only functions that don't have a [[Construct]] internal method are all built-ins. So even without the length constraint, the answer looks like no.

content.body: those functions are constructors tho, aren't they?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: those functions are constructors tho, aren't they?

content.body:
Nope:
```js
new (Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor({ get x() {} }, "x").get) 
// TypeError: Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(...).get is not a constructor
```
content.formatted_body:
Nope:

new (Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor({ get x() {} }, "x").get) 
// TypeError: Object.getOwnPropertyDescriptor(...).get is not a constructor

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
